name: Sadagaat
mission: Sadagaat seeks to contribute to improving the educational services of the poor segments by focusing on the education of special groups (children who are not enrolled in schools and the blind), in addition to improving the educational environment, building the capacities of the educational staff, and providing opportunities for professional education.
theoryOfChange: Empowering marginalized communities through a combination of immediate emergency relief (food/water) and sustainable development (education/infrastructure) to break the cycle of poverty.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sadagaat-usa.org/giving/zakat (Source: https://sadagaat-usa.org/giving/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 37/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, domestic poverty cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.

all_citations.claim: The charity has a 97.5/100 score, a 98.4% program expense ratio, and fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised.
The charity is Zakat-eligible and maintains specific policies for asnaf categories.
Total revenue is reported as $1,294,453 with working capital of 3.6 months.
The organization focuses on education for special groups, health care, feeding, and water sectors.
The organization maintains active legal status and organizational compliance.
Programs include improving educational environments and providing professional education opportunities.
The organization engages volunteers to support its mission and program delivery.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SADAGAAT-USA earns a strong overall profile due to its high Charity Navigator score of 97.5/100 and its commitment to direct service delivery with minimal overhead. Its Zakat-eligible status and focus on high-urgency domestic and international poverty align well with donor priorities.
areas_for_improvement: Limited working capital reserves, currently maintained at 3.6 months
Reliance on direct provision models which may require scaling for broader impact

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 37/50, the charity shows high donor fit, particularly for those seeking Zakat-eligible opportunities [2]. The mission addresses urgent needs such as special education for the blind and capacity building for educational staff, supported by a strong track record of organizational compliance [2][5][8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through direct provision of services in health, feeding, and water sectors, achieving an impact score of 39/50 [1][4]. Its financial health is robust, characterized by a 98.4% program expense ratio and a fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised, which maximizes the utility of its $1,294,453 total revenue [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: SADAGAAT-USA empowers marginalized communities through high-impact educational initiatives and essential humanitarian services.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 98.4%, ensuring nearly all funds reach beneficiaries
High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised
Verified Zakat-eligible status with clear policies for asnaf categories
baseline_narrative.summary: SADAGAAT-USA is a non-profit organization dedicated to improving educational services for impoverished segments, specifically focusing on children not enrolled in school and the visually impaired [4][6]. The organization maintains a high level of financial transparency and efficiency, reporting a total revenue of $1,294,453 and a program expense ratio of 98.4% [1][3].

strengths.detail: The organization directs an outstanding <cite id="3">100.0% to program expenses</cite>, maximizing the impact of donor contributions.
SADAGAAT-USA operates with remarkable fundraising efficiency, spending only <cite id="1">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>.
The charity has earned a <cite id="1">97.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, indicating excellent governance and financial health.

strengths_deep_dive: SADAGAAT-USA distinguishes itself through unparalleled financial efficiency and strong institutional transparency. By maintaining a <cite id="3">98.4% program expense ratio</cite>, the organization ensures that overhead costs do not dilute donor impact. This lean operational model is supported by a highly effective fundraising strategy that costs just <cite id="1">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. Furthermore, the charity's governance is robust, featuring an <cite id="1">8-member board</cite> and earning a <cite id="1">97.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, which provides donors with high confidence in its operational integrity.
rich_narrative.summary: SADAGAAT-USA is a humanitarian and educational organization dedicated to serving marginalized communities, with a strong focus on <cite id="4">children not enrolled in schools and the blind</cite>. Operating primarily in <cite id="4">Sudan and the United States</cite>, the organization delivers critical services across multiple sectors, including <cite id="4">feeding, water, health, and education</cite>. The charity has demonstrated exceptional financial efficiency, reporting <cite id="3">$1,294,453 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Remarkably, SADAGAAT-USA maintains a <cite id="3">98.4% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that virtually all contributions directly fund its charitable initiatives. This financial stewardship is further evidenced by its outstanding fundraising efficiency, costing just <cite id="1">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization's commitment to accountability is reflected in its <cite id="1">97.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and its Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid. For Muslim donors, SADAGAAT-USA is a highly aligned choice, offering <cite id="2">verified Zakat-eligible programs</cite> that specifically target the <cite id="2">fuqara and masakin</cite> categories. Over the past three years, the organization has experienced significant growth, achieving a <cite id="3">33.4% revenue CAGR</cite>, which highlights its expanding capacity to address urgent humanitarian crises and long-term educational needs.
